1{-# OPTIONS_GHC -Wall #-}
2
3-- | List utilities.
4
5module Koshucode.Baala.Base.List.List
6  ( -- * Test
7    isSingleton,
8    sameLength, notSameLength,
9
10    -- * Take
11    takeFirst, takeLast,
12    takeMiddle, takeEnd,
13    takeOdd, takeEven,
14    takeFill, takeTailFill,
15    takeChunks,
16  
17    -- * Construct
18    list1, list2, list3,
19    consIf,
20    RangeBy, rangeBy,
21    zipMaybe, zipMaybe2,
22
23    -- * Map
24    mapAt,
25    omit,
26    squeeze, squeezeEmptyLines,
27  ) where
28
29import qualified Koshucode.Baala.Overture         as O
30import qualified Koshucode.Baala.Base.List.Split  as B
31
32
33-- ----------------------  List
34
35-- | Test list has single element.
36isSingleton :: O.Test [a]
37isSingleton [_] = True
38isSingleton  _  = False
39
40-- | Test lengths of two lists are same.
41--
42--   >>> sameLength "abc" "ABC"
43--   True
44--
45sameLength :: O.Test2 [a] [b]
46sameLength a b = length a == length b
47
48-- | Test lengths of two lists are not same.
49--
50--   >>> notSameLength "abc" "ABC"
51--   False
52--
53notSameLength :: O.Test2 [a] [b]
54notSameLength a b = not $ sameLength a b
55
56
57-- ----------------------  Take
58
59-- | Take first element; if empty list is given, returns empty list.
60--
61--   >>> takeFirst "abc"
62--   "a"
63--
64--   >>> takeFirst ""
65--   ""
66takeFirst :: [a] -> [a]
67takeFirst = take 1
68
69-- | Take last element; if empty list is given, returns empty list.
70--
71--   >>> takeLast "abc"
72--   "c"
73--
74takeLast :: [a] -> [a]
75takeLast [] = []
76takeLast xs = [last xs]
77
78-- | Take middle /N/ elements.
79--
80--   >>> (`takeMiddle` ['A' .. 'Z']) <$> [-1 .. 7 :: Int]
81--   ["", "", "M", "MN", "LMN", "LMNO", "KLMNO", "KLMNOP", "JKLMNOP"]
82--
83takeMiddle :: Int -> [a] -> [a]
84takeMiddle n xs
85    | l <= n    = xs
86    | otherwise = take n $ drop h xs
87    where l = length xs
88          h = (l - n) `div` 2
89
90-- | Take /N/ elements at the end of the list.
91--
92--   >>> takeEnd 3 "ABCDEFG"
93--   "EFG"
94--
95takeEnd :: Int -> [a] -> [a]
96takeEnd n = (take n O./$/)
97
98-- | Take elements at odd positions, i.e., first, third, ...
99--
100--   >>> takeOdd "abcdeft"
101--   "acet"
102--
103takeOdd :: [a] -> [a]
104takeOdd []  = []
105takeOdd [x] = [x]
106takeOdd (x : _ : xs) = x : takeOdd xs
107
108-- | Take elements at even positions. i.e., second, fourth, ...
109--
110--   >>> takeEven "abcdeft"
111--   "bdf"
112--
113takeEven :: [a] -> [a]
114takeEven []  = []
115takeEven [_] = []
116takeEven (_ : x : xs) = x : takeEven xs
117
118-- | Take /N/ elements with filler.
119--
120--   >>> takeFill 0 3 [0 .. 8]
121--  [0,1,2]
122--
123--   >>> takeFill 0 5 [6 .. 8]
124--  [6,7,8,0,0]
125--
126takeFill :: a -> Int -> [a] -> [a]
127takeFill fill = loop where
128    loop 0 _       = []
129    loop n []      = fill : loop (n - 1) []
130    loop n (x:xs)  =    x : loop (n - 1) xs
131
132-- | Take tail-side /N/ elements with filler.
133--
134--   >>> takeTailFill 0 3 [0 .. 8]
135--  [6,7,8]
136--
137--   >>> takeTailFill 0 5 [6 .. 8]
138--  [0,0,6,7,8]
139--
140takeTailFill :: a -> Int -> [a] -> [a]
141takeTailFill fill n = (takeFill fill n O./$/)
142
143-- | Take indexed chunks from /N/ chunks.
144--
145--   >>> takeChunks 20 [10, 0, 19, 20] [0 .. 98 :: Int]
146--   [[50,51,52,53,54], [0,1,2,3,4], [95,96,97,98], []]
147--
148takeChunks :: Int -> [Int] -> [a] -> [[a]]
149takeChunks per ps xs = f <$> ps where
150    f p | p < 0     = []
151        | p >= per  = []
152        | otherwise = B.divideInto per xs !! p
153
154
155-- ----------------------  Construct
156
157-- | Make singleton list.
158--
159--   >>> list1 'a'
160--   "a"
161--
162{-# INLINE list1 #-}
163list1 :: a -> [a]
164list1 x = [x]
165
166-- | Make two-element list.
167--
168--   >>> list2 'a' 'b'
169--   "ab"
170--
171{-# INLINE list2 #-}
172list2 :: a -> a -> [a]
173list2 x y = [x, y]
174
175-- | Make three-element list.
176--
177--   >>> list3 'a' 'b' 'c'
178--   "abc"
179--
180{-# INLINE list3 #-}
181list3 :: a -> a -> a -> [a]
182list3 x y z = [x, y, z]
183
184-- | Conditional cons up.
185consIf :: Bool -> a -> [a] -> [a]
186consIf True  x xs  = x : xs
187consIf False _ xs  = xs
188
189-- | Range generation
190type RangeBy a = a -> a -> [a]
191
192-- | Generate range of something.
193--
194--   >>> rangeBy (+ 3) 0 10
195--   [0,3,6,9]
196--
197rangeBy :: (Ord a) => O.Map a -> RangeBy a
198rangeBy step from to = loop from where
199    loop f | f > to    = []
200           | otherwise = f : loop (step f)
201
202-- | Zip optoinal elements.
203--
204--   >>> zipMaybe [Just 'a', Nothing] "AB"
205--   [('a','A')]
206--
207zipMaybe :: [Maybe a] -> [b] -> [(a, b)]
208zipMaybe (Just a  : as) (b : bs)  = (a, b) : zipMaybe as bs
209zipMaybe (Nothing : as) (_ : bs)  =          zipMaybe as bs
210zipMaybe _  _                     = []
211
212-- | Zip filter.
213--
214--   >>> zipMaybe2 [Just 'a', Nothing] "AB"
215--   [('a','A')]
216--
217zipMaybe2 :: [Maybe a] -> [b] -> [b]
218zipMaybe2 (Just _  : as) (b : bs)  = b : zipMaybe2 as bs
219zipMaybe2 (Nothing : as) (_ : bs)  =     zipMaybe2 as bs
220zipMaybe2 _  _                     = []
221
222
223-- ----------------------  Map
224
225-- | Apply function to specific element.
226--
227--   >>> mapAt (const '-') 3 "abcdefg"
228--   "abc-efg"
229--
230mapAt :: O.Map a -> Int -> O.Map [a]
231mapAt f = loop where
232    loop 0 (x : xs) = f x : xs
233    loop i (x : xs) = x : loop (i - 1) xs
234    loop _ []       = []
235
236-- | Omit elements, i.e., anti-'filter'.
237--
238--   >>> omit (`elem` "ae") "abcdefg"
239--   "bcdfg"
240--
241omit :: (a -> Bool) -> O.Map [a]
242omit f = filter $ not . f
243
244-- | Compress continued multile elements into single elements.
245--
246--   >>> squeeze (== '?') "Koshu???"
247--   "Koshu?"
248--
249squeeze :: (a -> Bool) -> O.Map [a]
250squeeze p = loop where
251    loop (x1 : xxs@(x2 : _))
252        | p x1 && p x2 = squeeze p xxs
253        | otherwise    = x1 : squeeze p xxs
254    loop xs = xs
255
256-- | Compress continued white lines.
257--
258--   >>> squeezeEmptyLines ["a", "b", " ", "c", "", " ", "  ", "d"]
259--   ["a", "b", " ", "c", "  ", "d"]
260--
261squeezeEmptyLines :: O.Map [String]
262squeezeEmptyLines = squeeze $ null . dropWhile (== ' ')
263
